title: Sequence Layers
body:
This commit adds three utility layers to handle variable length sequences. They all take one input by default (`data` of dimensions `[max seq len, batch size, rest dims]`), and optionally takes a second argument `sequence_length` (a list of positive integers of length `batch size`), which can be activated by the option `use_sequence_length`. If no sequence lengths are given, it is assumed the sequences are all equally sized `max seq len`.
- `SequenceLast`: returns the last element of each sequence, thus a tensor of dim `[batch size, rest dims]`
- `SequenceReverse`: reverses each sequence. Needed for variable length bidirectional RNN.
- `SequenceMask`: masks all elements in a tensor not part of a sequence with zero. 

@antinucleon @pluskid

title: fix PrefetchingIter for provide_data/label
body:
`train_data = mx.io.PrefetchingIter(train_data)`
when training faster-rcnn, the shape of `data` and `label` in `train_data` is changed almost the time, so we need use the up to date value, and return provide_data/label in DataBatch.

Doesn't happen in Linux

title: Add `reverse` option in Reshape
body: If `reverse` is true, 0 values in the `shape` argument will be searched from the backward. E.g the original shape is (10, 5, 4) and the shape argument is (-1, 0). If `reverse` is true, the new shape should be (50, 4), otherwise it will be (40, 5).

title: [OP] Fix req and reserve_space in cudnn_rnn
body: In CuDNN V5, the `cudnnRNNBackwardWeights` will add the calculated gradients to the existing value. We thus need to initialize `dw` to 0 when `kAddTo` is not used. @sbodenstein, could you help review this? Also, I'm not clear about the layout of `parameters` for multiple stacked LSTM layers. For a single layer, I find the layout is `[flatten(i2h_weight), flatten(h2h_weight), flatten(i2h_bias), flatten(h2h_bias)]`, but that doesn't hold for multiple LSTM layers.

title: [PYTHON] Optional Cython Module for Symbols
body:
Only performance critical parts are done using cython, most codes go through ctypes
- the folder cython contains cython specific implementation of certain modules
  - cython class is compatible with ctypes class, so other slow module can simply be implemented by ctypes without using cython.
- the folder ctypes contains ctypes specific implementation of certain modules

When cython is not available, ctypes will be used by default. The build package will work under any python version and regardless whether cython module is available

cython module can be build via

`make cython2` and `make cython3`.

repo.name: mxnet
repo.description: Lightweight, Portable, Flexible Distributed/Mobile Deep Learning with Dynamic, Mutation-aware Dataflow Dep Scheduler; for Python, R, Julia, Scala, Go, Javascript and more

title: Improve multi-GPU performance
body:
This is a major refactor of src/kvstore, we should obtain multiple confirmations from users before merging.
## performance improvement

will try to use gpu pear-to-pear communication if available for `kvstore=device`. together with PR #3238 , it potentially improves the performance using >=4 gpus training, or training multiple jobs at the same time. for example, using 8 m40, we can improve resnet 152 layers from 300 img/sec to 353 img/sec. even larger improvement is from distributed training. 

we also provide tools in `tools/bandwidth` to measure the GPU bandwidth for various neural networks and hardwares. 
## changes for the interface
1. new kvstore types `dist_sync_device` and `dist_async_device` for using GPU p2p communication in distributed training.
2. which type kvstore will be created? (no different to current naming convention) 
   - if `"device" in name`, then will use GPU p2p for push and pull. otherwise all data go to cpu memory directly. 
   - if `"dist" in name`, use distributed kvstore. 
     - if "async" in name, use async communication; otherwise use synced communication
3. the optimizer added into kvstore will run on GPUs when `kvstore=device`. previous we will copy data to cpu first. so the new way may accelerate things, but require the optimizer to be able to run GPUs

~~4. the function `_create_kvstore` in `model.py` always returns `update_on_kvstore=True` to simplify things. we can further remove all logic related to `update_on_kvstore`.~~ 
## further things

we can use unified memory to solve #2919 we only need to
- remove some context checks
- remove the gpu buffer, do elementwisesum on ndarray from different gpus directly  

but i observed decreased performance on using unified memory. so we probably only enable it for very large arrays, e.g. fullc weight in vgg.

repo.name: mxnet

title: NNVM Refactor
body:
This is a PR that moves the symbolic layer to  https://github.com/dmlc/nnvm

This will enable new stage of mxnet's system optimization, by allowing more generic attributes and optimization passes that can be independent from each other. This refactor is backward compatible in API in a sense that all API is re-implemented with NNVM calls, without changing the interface.

Current changes:
- Move symbolic API to NNVM @tqchen
  - Most front-end C API are backward  compatible
  - Removed symbolic api in MXNet and relies on NNVM
- Known features removed limitations to be fixed
  - Bulk segment execution not yet added.
  - The gradient aggregation optimization hack by switching to addto is not yet added,
    can harm LSTM if it is constructed by unrolling the graph

Due to the major changes, the code will sit into a new branch first, before it get merged into master.

repo.description: Lightweight, Portable, Flexible Distributed/Mobile Deep Learning with Dynamic, Mutation-aware Dataflow Dep Scheduler; for Python, R, Julia, Scala, Go, Javascript and more

title: MXNet Profiler
body:
This is a profiler for profiling time consuming of MXNet operations, whose purpose is to find and analysis MXNet performance issues.

There are two samples below:
![trace_matmul0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17693755/18035926/bb4e000e-6d92-11e6-9452-7b68507b35e8.png)

This is a matrix multiplication sample where both operators' shape is (4096, 4096).

![trace_matmul1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17693755/18035937/fa92b692-6d92-11e6-94e9-9af48b864f00.png)

After zooming it on, We can see that each matrix multiplication consuming about 25ms, and the scheduling time between two multiplications is about 0.1ms.

![trace_symbol0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17693755/18035938/0a43484a-6d93-11e6-80d4-241c6ca552ea.png)

This is a five iteration trace of executing a five layers MLP model.

![trace_symbol1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17693755/18035939/14765974-6d93-11e6-8db8-3ba5e3741e43.png)

Similarly, You can see more detail by zooming it on, clicking it.

Sample code:

[example/profiler_matmul.py](https://github.com/ZihengJiang/mxnet/blob/master/example/profiler/profiler_matmul.py)
[example/profiler_executor.py](https://github.com/ZihengJiang/mxnet/blob/master/example/profiler/profiler_executor.py)
[example/profiler_ndarray.py](https://github.com/ZihengJiang/mxnet/blob/master/example/profiler/profiler_ndarray.py)

Here are the [sample trace files](https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B1C9W-xXOUiRc1JTSU5hVGcyM2s).

(just load the trace file at chrome://tracing in your Chrome browser, then enjoy it:D)

I would appreciate it if anyone can review the code, thanks!

title: Add function 'print_summary' and some revise
body:
Add function 'print_summary' for print detail information of network, and format argument was add in 'plot_network'.
You can use 'print_summary' like:
"""
net = get_symbol(1000)
shape = {'softmax_label': (64, 1000), 'data': (64, 3, 224, 224)}
mx.viz.print_summary(net, shape=shape)
"""
If without shape, the number of arguments would be nonsense currently.

title: Using consistent `metric.get()` return.
body:
If  `metric.get()` returns inconsistent results, it will cause strange outputs returned by `CompositeEvalMetric.get()`.
For example, two different metrics return `(name1,value1)` and `([name2,name3],[value2, value3])` by the original `metric.get()`, then we will get a result of `([name1, [name2, name3]],[value1, [value2, value3]])` by `CompositeEvalMetric.get()`, which will cause a bug when we use the result.

title: fix batch norm
body:
@winstywang @antinucleon @tornadomeet 
Current master doesn't set gamma to 1 during testing, in order to accommodate old models introduced before fix_gamma was introduced and set to true by default.

However this creates another problem as kvstore_local keeps a internal copy of all the weights so resetting to 1 inside bn is ignored and overwritten by kv's internal copy. As a result weight decay decreases gamma to 0 during training.

This PR fix this by resetting gamma whenever BN::Forward/Backward is called. However this invalidates all models trained before Dec 5 2015.

My suggestion is to merge this when we release 1.0 and explain this to the users in transition guide as well as provide a converter that set fix_gamma to false in .json symbols.

title: fix l2_normalization shape bug
body:
Found a bug when using L2Normalizatino layer. Shape inconsistent.
Dig into the code and found the original code tried to "FlatTo2D" which collapse the higher dimensions first.
If I didn't get it wrong, we should keep the first dimension which is the batch number, and fold the lower dimensions all together.

repo.name: mxnet

title: [Op] SequenceReverse
body:
- a new layer which reverses sequences.
- takes two arguments, `"data"` of the form `[sequence, batch, rest]`, and `"sequence_length"`, a vector of integers `>=1` and of length `batch`. Returns another tensor of the same size as the input.
- leaves padding unchanged.
- a number of applications, eg. bidirectional RNN's
